title.value: An Empirical Study of Self-Admitted Technical Debt in Machine Learning Software
title.justification: The title aptly encapsulates the paper's primary focus on studying self-admitted technical debt in machine learning projects from an empirical perspective.
title.quote: An Empirical Study of Self-Admitted Technical Debt in Machine Learning Software

extractions.description: The paper investigates the presence and characteristics of self-admitted technical debt (SATD) in machine learning (ML) software by analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains. The study compares the occurrence of SATD in ML projects with non-ML projects, categorizes the types of SATD found, examines the stages of the ML pipeline prone to SATD, and explores the dynamics of SATD introduction and removal.

type.justification: The study involves collecting, analyzing, and comparing data from 318 ML projects and 318 non-ML projects to draw empirical conclusions.
type.quote: This paper aims to investigate the occurrence of SATD in ML code by analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains, along with 318 non-ML projects.

primary_research_field.justification: The paper focuses on self-admitted technical debt within the context of machine learning software, which is a subfield of deep learning.
primary_research_field.quote: The emergence of open-source ML libraries such as TensorFlow and Google Auto ML has enabled developers to harness state-of-the-art ML algorithms with minimal overhead.

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper specifically addresses issues related to software engineering practices in machine learning projects.
sub_research_fields.quote: This paper aims to investigate the occurrence of SATD in ML code by analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains, along with 318 non-ML projects.

name.justification: Support Vector Machine (SVM) is mentioned as an example of a traditional machine learning model.
name.quote: Using a traditional ML model, say SVM, for image classification would require manual feature extraction.

caracteristics.justification: SVM is a traditional machine learning model.
caracteristics.quote: Using a traditional ML model, say SVM, for image classification would require manual feature extraction.

name.justification: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are mentioned as an important type of deep learning model used for image classification.
name.quote: Paying off this TD by upgrading SVM to a Deep Learning model like CNN can itself cause massive ripple effects across multiple components.

caracteristics.justification: CNN is a commonly used deep learning model.
caracteristics.quote: Paying off this TD by upgrading SVM to a Deep Learning model like CNN can itself cause massive ripple effects across multiple components.

name.justification: TensorFlow is mentioned as an example of an open-source machine learning library.
name.quote: The emergence of open-source ML libraries such as TensorFlow and Google Auto ML has enabled developers to harness state-of-the-art ML algorithms with minimal overhead.

name.justification: Google Auto ML is mentioned as an example of an open-source machine learning library.
name.quote: The emergence of open-source ML libraries such as TensorFlow and Google Auto ML has enabled developers to harness state-of-the-art ML algorithms with minimal overhead.

name.justification: Scikit-Learn is mentioned as a popular toolkit that enables developers to leverage state-of-the-art ML algorithms.
name.quote: The advent of popular ML toolkits, such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Auto ML, has enabled developers to easily leverage state-of-the-art ML algorithms to quickly develop ML-based systems with minimal overhead.
